required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The NeoBeat Efficacy Study for Newborns
clinical_study.official_title: Enhanced Heart Rate Monitoring of Newborns After Birth and During Resuscitation

brief_summary.textblock: In a multicenter randomized controlled trial the investigators will evaluate the efficacy of the novel heart rate meter NeoBeat on ventilation performance and short-term outcomes compared to standard care in newborns in need of positive pressure ventilation to initiate spontaneous breathing after birth.

detailed_description.textblock:
Heart rate assessment immediately after birth in newborn infants is the most important clinical indicator to evaluate the status of a newborn, and critical to the correct guidance of resuscitation efforts.
One of the knowledge gaps identified by the International Liason Committee on Resuscitation (ILCOR) is how best to assess ventilation during newborn resuscitation, and improved technology for rapid application of ECG.
Laerdal Medical has developed a novel heart rate meter, NeoBeat, implementing ECG dry-electrodes in a snug-fit abdomen-shaped buckle for for rapid application on the newborn.
In a multicenter randomized controlled trial the investigators will study the efficacy of NeoBeat on ventilation performance and short-term outcomes compared to standard care in newborns in need of positive pressure ventilation to initiate spontaneous respiration after birth.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of cases with adherence to resuscitation guidelines in non-breathing newborns
primary_outcome.description: Defined as initiation of PPV within on minute

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time from birth to initiation of PPV
secondary_outcome.description: defined as seconds between birth and initiation of PPV

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in total duration of PPV
secondary_outcome.description: defined as seconds of PPV in total

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time from birth to a stable HR ≥100 and 120 bpm
secondary_outcome.description: defined as HR ≥100 and 120 bpm for ≥ 60 seconds after discontinuing PPV

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in time for pulse oximeter saturation to reach stable values of ≥ 95% without oxygen supplementation
secondary_outcome.description: defined as seconds between birth to reach saturation values ≥ 95% without oxygen supplementation
defined as proportion of time of PPV with Vt ≥ 6 ml/kg
defined as cumulative number of seconds with PPV efforts excluding pauses

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in number of infants with Apgar score <7 at 5 and 10 minutes
Change in NICU admission rate after resuscitation
secondary_outcome.description: defined as percentage of newborns needing admission to the NICU after resuscitation

arm_group.description: NeoBeat will be placed on all newborns immediately after birth to assess the heartrate for at least 5 minutes, or longer if the newborn needs resuscitation. Intervention subjects will have a visible display of the heart rate on the NeoBeat, to guide healthcare providers in further management of the newborn.

NeoBeat will be placed on the newborn to collect information on heart rate, but heart rate is not displayed to the healthcare providers. If the newborn is in need of resuscitation to initiate spontaneous respiration, the baby will be transferred to the resuscitation bay. According to recommendations the heart rate should be assessed and positive pressure ventilation initiated within one minute of life. Standard care is to assess heart rate by conventional ECG and/or pulse oximetry, alternatively auscultation of the heart.

intervention.description: NeoBeat (Laerdal Medical) is a CE approved novel heart rate meter, able to detect heart rate in newborns within seconds of birth. The NeoBeat uses ECG dry-electrodes in a snug-fit abdomen-shaped buckle for rapid application around the newborn`s abdomen or thorax. It allows healthcare providers to reliably assess heart rate of the newborn immediately after birth and continuously during resuscitation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Inborn, Gestational age ≥ 28 weeks, Multiples according to availability of equipment
Exclusion Criteria:
Congenital malformations that interfere with the intervention, Non-consent
